### Top AI Stories

1. [What Is an AI Stack? LLMs, RAG, & AI Hardware](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RRKwmeyIc24)

2. [Google Launches FREE AI Course (With Certificate & Swags!)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tlDCW42Bag)

3. [How Are LLM Model Updates Managed? - AI and Machine Learning Explained](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E90ea3uV2fc)

4. [AI Engineering Live Course](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8NrejliPcQc)

5. [AI vs ML Explained Simply! #simplilearn](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r6Fv1F8YQCI)

6. [Experiments in LLMs â€“ Everything I've learned (so far) â€“ Part One â€“ Fine tuning](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36381832)

7. [Experiments in LLMs â€“ OpenAI Functions](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36534635)

8. [Experiments in LLMs â€“ Vector DBs and Embeddings](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36447740)

9. [Show HN: AI-Powered Twitter Filter](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=39210964)

10. [Show HN: AI/ML Weekly Digest â€“ Curated by LLM, Summarized and Sentiment-Analyzed](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=37954932)

### AI Trends Summary

An AI Stack encompasses the layers of technology including Large Language Models (LLMs), Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), and specialized AI hardware, indicating the complex infrastructure behind AI systems. Google has introduced a free AI course, providing participants with a certificate and exclusive swag, aiming to make AI education more accessible. Updates to LLM models are managed through a series of sophisticated processes to ensure the models' effectiveness and accuracy. AI Engineering is becoming more accessible through live courses, catering to the growing demand for skilled professionals in the field. Finally, there's a distinction made between AI and Machine Learning (ML), with resources like Simplilearn offering simple explanations to demystify the technology for a broader audience, highlighting the educational efforts to clarify and disseminate AI and ML knowledge to the public.

### Summary

The national debt in the United States has soared to over $38 trillion, significantly increasing the financial burden on American taxpayers. Ongoing government shutdowns have led to flight cuts at Americaâ€™s top 10 busiest airports, exacerbating travel disruptions. In a notable corporate development, Tesla shareholders have approved a massive $1 trillion pay package for Elon Musk, highlighting the company's ambitious future plans. Meanwhile, Barstool Sportsâ€™ Dave Portnoy is contemplating closing the company's New York City office due to his disapproval of Zohran Mamdani's election victory, indicating the potential impact of political changes on local businesses.

tech_news.markdown:
## ðŸ’» Tech News - 2025-11-07

### Top Stories

1. [Commerce committee approves AM radio requirement for cars](https://www.eenews.net/articles/committee-approves-am-radio-requirement-for-cars/)

2. [Time Immemorial turns 750: The Medieval law that froze history at 1189](https://www.ianvisits.co.uk/articles/time-immemorial-turns-750-the-medieval-law-that-froze-history-at-1189-84893/)

3. [$40M 3D printing factory open for business on Guam, will produce parts for Navy](https://www.guampdn.com/news/40m-3d-printing-factory-now-open-for-business-on-guam-will-produce-parts-of-navy/article_0bff0888-b760-4eb4-868a-9bcb46eb507f.html)

4. [We Teach: Reflections from higher education academics from around the world](https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/abstract/document/10359379)

5. [Life After Cars](https://www.lifeaftercars.com)

6. [Diffusion Language Models Are Super Data Learners](https://arxiv.org/abs/2511.03276)

7. [Mirror Organisms â€“ Exestential Risk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mirror_life)

8. [Rep Moolenaar to Columbia University: Cut Ties with CCP-Backed Exchange Programs](https://selectcommitteeontheccp.house.gov/media/press-releases/moolenaar-to-columbia-university-cut-ties-with-ccp-backed-exchange-programs)

9. [Show HN: ApiMug â€“ Terminal UI for Browsing / Testing APIs from OpenAPI/Swagger](https://github.com/doganarif/ApiMug)

10. [BlocksDS Nintendo DS(I) devkit now supports WPA2 networks in homebrew software](https://blocksds.skylyrac.net/docs/introduction/changelog/)

### Summary

1. The commerce committee has passed a mandate requiring new cars to include AM radio, emphasizing the importance of maintaining access to this traditional broadcast medium for safety and emergency information.
   
2. Time Immemorial, a medieval law established in 1189, marks its 750th anniversary, highlighting how this ancient legislation has influenced legal precedents and historical perceptions up to the present day.

3. A new $40 million 3D printing facility has commenced operations in Guam, focusing on producing parts for the Navy, showcasing the growing role of additive manufacturing in supporting military logistics and supply chains.

4. "We Teach" offers insights from academics worldwide, reflecting on the challenges, innovations, and future directions in higher education, underscoring the global nature of teaching and learning in the modern academic landscape.

5. "Life After Cars" explores the societal, environmental, and urban changes anticipated in a future with reduced dependency on automobiles, discussing the potential for more sustainable and community-focused living environments.
